page.title: 09TRANSPORT IN WOOLMER GREEN
page.content: The old A1 main road runs through {Woolmer Green }and is still a busy road with {500}vehicles passing through an hour. The motorway which passes through the area and has by_passed the village is the A1(M),this has over {1200}vehicles pass each hour.The A1(M) is the main London to Scotland road. The main railway line from Kings Cross to Edinburgh passes to the West of the village with the nearest station 1.6 km away in Knebworth. Buses pass regularly through the village to Potters Bar or Stevenage and provide a half a hourly service through the day. Children from secondary schools have coaches or use the public bus service because the nearest secondary school is too far away to walk.
